member.name: T:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedTreeView
member.summary: Base class for specialized treeview controls. This class can control the treeview width based on all expanded nodes width. This class can control the treeview height based on current screen work area - DONE This class can control treeview content (copy another treeview). - DONE

member.summary: Copies a TreeView.

member.summary: Copies a TreeView.

member.summary: Iterates TreeView, including checked TreeViews. Used by the CopyTo method.

member.summary: Retrieves all checked nodes' tag values as a CSV. Written by Chinedu.
member.returns: Delimited string of node tag values.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedTreeView.GetCheckedValues(System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of TreeView checked items, using recursion. Written by Georgi.
member.param: If true, one of the parents was checked.
member.remarks: Additional documentation by Chinedu: This method accepts a node as long as ANY of the parents - all the way to the root - is checked.

member.summary: Clears/Checks all checked items

member.summary: Inverts the selection.

member.summary: Selects a single item, by key.

member.summary: Checks all items (only if the ListView's CheckBoxes property is TRUE, obviously).

member.summary: Unchecks all items (only if the ListView's CheckBoxes property is TRUE, obviously)..

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.InvertChecked
member.summary: Inverts the Checks.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.OnClick(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when an item is clicked. It guarantees that the ItemClick event is only bubbled up if an item was clicked.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.OnDoubleClick(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when an item is double-clicked. It guarantees that the ItemClick event is only bubbled up if an item was clicked.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.OnSelectedIndexChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when an item is selected or deselected. It only bubbles up the SelectedIndexChanged event if RaiseSelectedIndexChangedEvent is TRUE. In addition, if RaiseSelectedIndexChangedEventOnSelection is TRUE, it only bubbles up if at least 1 item is selected.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.Add(System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem)
member.summary: Adds an item to the ListView and sets the IsListChanged flag.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.AddRange(System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem[])
member.summary: Adds an item to the ListView and sets the IsListChanged flag.
member.param: Array of ListViewItems to be added.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.DeleteAll(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes all items, with optional confirmation.
member.param: If TRUE, the user is prompted to confirm the action.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.DeleteSelected(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes selected items, with optional confirmation.
member.param: If TRUE, the user is prompted to confirm the action.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.OnItemDrag(System.Windows.Forms.ItemDragEventArgs)
member.summary: Begin drag-and-drop operations. It uses the custom DragDropObject, which includes a pointer to the source control.

member.summary: Simulate dragging and dropping.

member.summary: Simulate dragging over.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.OnDragOver(System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs)
member.summary: Ensures that the user cannot drag-and-drop an item from a control to SAME control. It also ensures that only the "acceptable" types can be dropped onto it. This includes FileDrops (so we can drag files in from Explorer).

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedListView.OnResize(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Called when the control is resized for any reason. If ResizableColumnIndex is set, resize the appropriate column.

member.summary: Handle the CTRL+A and DEL key sequences, for SELECT ALL and DELETE, respectively.

member.summary: If set, the control displays some phantom text when there are no ListItems.

member.summary: This is the phantom text that will be displayed when there are no ListItems.

member.summary: If set, the control bubbles up the SelectedIndexChanged event.

member.name: T:KCS.Common.Controls.ValuesTracker
member.summary: Facilitates saving a form's position and values of the child controls (user-entered values only). It can also be used standalone (without associating it with a Form). That is, it supports adding and retrieving arbitrary values manually (via the overloaded AddValue and GetValue methods). In "Form" mode, the data is loaded in the associated form's Load event, and saved in the form's Closing event. Data is serialized and saved in an IsolatedStorage file, scoped to the User & Application.
member.remarks: Future Improvements: 1. The first version only works with a Form, but it could potentially be adapted to work with User Controls as well. 2. It enumerates ALL the controls on a Form (even nested ones), and looks at ALL controls. However, only a subset of controls accept user input, so only those are automatically tracked. 3. Any ComboBox (or subclass of same) must have their ValueMember set, in order to work with this component.
member.example:
To use it with a Form ("Form mode"), at design-time: 1. Drop the component on the Form. THAT'S ALL. To add additional values before the controls are restored, do so in this component's Loaded event handler.
To use it WITHOUT a form ("Standalone mode"): 1. Instantiate the control with the "storageKey" constructor. 2. Use AddValue() as needed. 3. Call Save() as needed. This persists the values to disk. 4. To reload the values into memory, call Load(). 5. Call GetValue() as needed, to retrieve specific values by key (the same keys used in the calls to AddValue() ). You can also call Restore() to simply restore all the stored values to their matching controls.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ValuesTracker.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.param: Form to be associated with this control.

member.summary: Alternate constructor - sets the Auto flag to FALSE.

member.summary: Sets a byte array representation of the internal dictionary.

member.summary: Gets a byte array representation of the internal dictionary.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ValuesTracker.SubscribeToEventHandlers
member.summary: Subscribes to the Shown, FormClosing, Move, and Resize events of the associated form. This allows auto-save and auto-restore, as well as tracking the size and position of the Form.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ValuesTracker.FormLoad(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: After the associated form is loaded, restores the form's control values (if Auto is true).

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ValuesTracker.FormClosing(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.FormClosingEventArgs)
member.summary: When the form is closing, saves all the values (if Auto is true).

member.summary: Saves the form's size and location when it is moved or resized. Does not apply when the form is minimized.

member.summary: Tracks the form's size and position.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ValuesTracker.Save
member.summary: Saves the values to the data store. If a Form is available, it first saves the child controls values.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ValuesTracker.Load
member.summary: Loads all the previously-saved values from isolated storage.

member.name: M:KCS.Common.Controls.ValuesTracker.RestoreFormBounds
member.summary: Restores ONLY the location of the associated form. If the form falls complete outside the bounds of all the available monitors, this method adjusts the form's position.

member.name: T:KCS.Common.Controls.ExtendedDataGridView
member.summary: Base class for all the specialized DataGridViews. Provides batch functions and special events. It also associates with an AssociatedToolStrip, to allow for item operations.

member.summary: Copies and clears the selected cells.

member.summary: Pastes from the CopiedData table. This assumes that the DataSource is a DataTable. If it is not, then handle the DataPasting event, set Cancel to TRUE, and implement the pasting yourself.

member.summary: Ensures that the user cannot drag-and-drop an item from a control to SAME control. It also ensures that only the "acceptable" types can be dropped onto it. This includes FileDrops (so we can drag files in from Explorer).

member.summary: If set, the control displays some phantom text when there are no Rows.

member.summary: This is the phantom text that will be displayed when there are no Rows.

member.summary: This is the alternate phantom text that will be displayed when there are no ListItems.
